cab.content: MR. G.M.YOUNGPrinted for the War Cabinet. March 1917.SECRET.WAR CABINET, 90Minutes of a Meeting of the War Cabinet held at 10, Downing Street, S.W., cmWednesday, Mareli 7, 1917, at 12*80 p.m.Present:The Prime Minister (in the Chair).The Right Hon. the Earl Curzon of kedleston, K.G., O.C.S.T., G.C.I.E.The Right Hon. the Viscount Milner,G.C.B., G.O.M.G.J The Right Elon. A. Henderson, M.P.The Right Hon. A. Bonar Law, M.P.The following were also present: The Right Hon. A. J. Balfour, O.M.,M.P., Secretary of State for ForeignAffairs.The Right Hon. W. Long, M.P., Secretaryof State for the Colonies.The Right Hon. Sir E. Carson, K.C.,M.P., First Lord of the Admiralty.The Right Hon. Fl. E. Duke, K.C., M.P.,Chief Secretary for Ireland.Lieutenant-Colonel Sir M. P. A. Hankey, K.C.B., Secretary.Ireland. THE War Cabinet discussed the attitude to be adopted towardsthe Resolution to be moved by the Irish party, and decided on thepolicy announced by the Prime Minister in the House of commons on the same afternoon.(initialled) D. LI. G.2, Whitehall Gardens, S.W.,March 7, 1917.[1365-90]
